channel.title: Deleting ALL Objects
channel.description:
I already know there is a code to remove objects like the one below. [code] } public void Deleteobjects() { deletethatobject(0000, 0000);[/code]
Would it be possible to make a code that deletes ALL objects in the game... Like I could put if ObjectX>=0000 && ObjectY>=0000, and then it would delete them.. I tried everything, for some reason its not working. Anyone think of a code?
If you can help me it would mean a lot to me, I'm trying to start something new.

item.title: Deleting ALL Objects
item.dc:creator: @Runefell Runefell
item.description:
@Runefell wrote:

It makes the server crash repeatedly after reconnection. I wish there was a way to make it so the objects don’t load in the first place, but I suppose thats far more complicated.

I wonder if it will work for a small area, is there a command kind of like the Wilderness command where I can set the coordinates, but instead it will be setting the coordinates of the objects being deleted?

Thank you for your help and please reply back.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting ALL Objects
item.dc:creator: @Pluvia Pluvia
item.description:
@Pluvia wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:363778”]You could try using a loop, it may just crash the server though. :rolleyes:

for (int i = 0; i < 9999; i++) deletethatobject(i, i);[/quote]
yeah I think it would make it crash really what you should do is go into the client.java and find the globalobjects and deleate them but this could take ages so just deleaate the ones you want to. then make global objects load from a .cgf file using lins tut on it look at deathchaos9 topic in tutroirals section. its wayyyyyy at the bottem

Read full topic
